intro: [WRONG START] Brassicae erucastrum var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in Nevada and surrounding regions. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often hairy. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and adaptations to dry conditions.
